title: Massachusetts Investigates Potential Target-Date Funds Tax Issue
sub_head: Secretary of the commonwealth sends letters to five asset-management companies
body:
Massachusetts is investigating some asset-management companies over potential tax-disclosure issues related to target-date mutual fund offerings.
Secretary of the Commonwealth William Galvin said Tuesday his officeâ€™s Securities Division sent letters to Vanguard Group, Fidelity Investments, T. Rowe Price Group Inc., American Funds Distributors and BlackRock Investments. The division is asking the companies for information related to client accounts and target-date mutual funds offered in the state, and any disclosures, marketing materials and educational materials offered with those funds.
